results.title: Burke and Wills
results.creator_credit: Michael Thomas, Graeme Clifford, John Sexton, Hoyts Edgley and Australian Film Investment Corporation
results.brief_description:
An epic journey from a turbulent chapter in Australia’s past, ‘Burke and Wills’ is the story of the explorers Burke and Wills’ expedition across the Australian continent in 1860. Jack Thompson is Robert O’Hara Burke, a strong Irishman obsessed with the desire to ‘write the map’; Nigel Havers is William John Wills, the archetypal Victorian gentleman explorer.

The film explores the changing relationship between the two men as they struggle with the harsh Australian environment they are attempting to chart.

results.title: Long weekend
results.brief_description: A young couple decide to spend a long weekend away in the bush together in an attempt to save their failing marriage. They head for a beach so isolated that even the locals have not heard of it. Strange things begin to happen, including the disappearance of their dog and then the girl herself. Cast includes John Hargreaves and Briony Behets.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee
results.creator_credit: Peter Faiman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter, Mick ‘Crocodile’ Dundee, and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. Stars Paul Hogan and Linda Kozlowski.

results.title: Summerfield
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Patricia Lovell and Clare Beach Films
results.brief_description: When a newcomer arrives in a small, secluded town to discover that the former teacher has disappeared, he probes into the mystery and becomes more and more intrigued by the inhabitants of a forbidding house called Summerfield. Eventually, the secrets of Summerfield are revealed in a dramatic ending with a shock twist. Directed by Ken Hannam (director of ‘Sunday Too Far Away’) and starring, Nick Tate, Elizabeth Alexander and John Waters, ‘Summerfield’ was shot on location at Victoria’s Phillip and Churchill Islands.

results.title: The Club
results.creator_credit: David Williamson, Bruce Beresford, Matt Carroll, New South Wales Film Corporation and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Laurie Holden (Jack Thompson) is coach of a Victorian Football League (VFL) team that hasn’t won a premiership for 19 years. Club president Ted Parker (Graham Kennedy) brings in a star recruit at great expense, but youngster Geoff Hayward (John Howard) is a major disappointment. As the club loses a string of games, the coach, president, committee members and players start to tear each other apart. Synopsis source: Australian Screen.

results.title: The Coolangatta Gold
results.creator_credit: Igor Auzins, John Weiley, Hoyts and Michael Edgley International
results.brief_description: A young son is filled with burning resentment at being forced to live in his brother’s shadow. His brother is burdened by their father’s desire for glory. Their father is obsessed by the need to redeem his own failure twenty years before. A dramatic story of family conflict which culminates in the spectacular excitement of the greatest beach and surf triaquathon in the world, the Coolangatta Gold. Both brothers enter the race, one to win for his father, one bent to beat his father. To do so, they must also compete against each other. Cast: Joss McWilliam, Nick Tate, Robyn Nevin, Josephine Smulders, Colin Friels.

results.title: The Chant of Jimmie Blacksmith
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi and The Film House
results.brief_description: Based on the Thomas Keneally novel, this is the fictionalised story of Jimmy Governor, who, in 1901 went on a rampage killing numerous white settlers. Deft characterisation and ironic detail combine to paint a bleak portrait of a bitterly racist society emerging as a federated nation. Starring Tommy Lewis in the title role with co-stars Ray Barrett and Jack Thompson.

constellations_other.name: Fred Schepisi
constellations_other.description: Fred Schepisi's diverse body of work connects to acclaimed local productions, westerns and Hollywood favourites.

results.title: The Adventures of Barry McKenzie
results.creator_credit: Bruce Beresford, Phillip Adams and Longford
results.brief_description: Barry Crocker plays Barry McKenzie, a wild colonial who heads off for London with a legacy left to him by an uncle. He makes straight for Earls Court to join up with his mates, and from there rampages through London with his Aunt Edna (Barry Humphries), “cracking tubes”, “chundering”, and “pointing Percy in the snake’s room” all the way. His adventures culminate in an interview, (minus his trousers), with Joan Blakewell and the BBC. Dennis Price, in one of the last films he made before he died, with Spike Milligan and Peter Cook add their comic talents to this ‘adventurous’ movie.

results.title: Dot and the kangaroo
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: Dot, the little daughter of a settler in the Australian outback loses her way in the bush. Terrified by the dark shadows and unfamiliar sounds of the bush, she is soon befriended by a big kangaroo. Dot travels in the kangaroo’s pouch on an adventure packed journey. She meets many bush animals and birds - koala, platypus, kookaburra and other indigenous Australian creatures. She runs into danger as she and the kangaroo are chased by angry dingoes. There is tension and excitement until, with the help of the bush creatures, Dot finally finds her home and the kangaroo returns to her natural environment.

results.title: They're a weird mob
results.brief_description: ‘They’re a Weird Mob’ is about Sydney, Australia in 1965 - a sprawling, growing city of three million people - and what people! Easy going, down-to-earth and hilariously funny - a very weird mob. Into this city arrives innocent Italian migrant, Nino Culotta. The adventures of Nino fitting in with the ‘weird mob’, learning their ways and outlandish language are shown in this Australian comedy classic. The film was carefully marketed as an ‘Australian’ production, despite Powell’s presence as producer-director, his British director of photography, and a screenplay by his regular collaborator in England, Emeric Pressburger (using the pseudonym Richard Imrie). Based on the book by Nino Culotta (John O’Grady). Cast includes Walter Cohiari, Clare Dunne, Chips Rafferty, Ed Devereaux, John Meillion and Tony Bonner.
